entries.content:
Moti is uncertain which approach to take for Claude tool positioning fix:
- Solution 1: Everything in stream (tools as DOM nodes inside stream-text)
- Solution 2: Break stream (create new stream-text segments when tools arrive)

Key constraint: UI must work universally for all providers (Claude, Codex, etc.) because we have universal message format. The fix cannot be provider-specific.

DECISION MADE: Going with Solution 2 (Break Stream) for Claude tool positioning fix.

Reasoning:
- Solution 1 (everything in stream) is the "right" architecture for the future
- But NOT now - too risky, requires major refactor of MarkdownRenderer
- Solution 2 is pragmatic: minimal changes, preserves existing rendering logic
- Cursor management: When stream breaks, cursor moves to new stream-text element

Implementation approach: When tool arrives during streaming, close current stream-text, insert tool, create new stream-text for subsequent text chunks, move cursor to new element.
